intro: Alpinia erecta, commonly known as the upright ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features tall, slender stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. Its flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences and can be either yellow or white in color. Alpinia erecta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in herbal medicine.
